solution_line_template: Lionel has enough Graham crackers to make {total_graham_crackers}/{graham_crackers_per_cheesecake} = <<{total_graham_crackers}/{graham_crackers_per_cheesecake}={cheesecakes_from_graham_crackers}>>{cheesecakes_from_graham_crackers} Oreo cheesecakes
Lionel has enough Oreos to make {total_oreos}/{oreos_per_cheesecake} = <<{total_oreos}/{oreos_per_cheesecake}={cheesecakes_from_oreos}>>{cheesecakes_from_oreos} Oreo cheesecakes
Therefore, the maximum number of cheesecakes Lionel can make is {max_cheesecakes}.

Lionel needs {graham_crackers_per_cheesecake} * {max_cheesecakes} = <<{graham_crackers_per_cheesecake}*{max_cheesecakes}={graham_crackers_used}>>{graham_crackers_used} boxes of Graham crackers to make 4 cheesecakes
